00024 void eol_armature_load_config()
00025 {
00026   _eol_armature_max = 255;
00027 }
00028 
00029 void eol_armature_init()
00030 {
00031   eol_logger_message(EOL_LOG_INFO,"eol_armature: initializing\n");
00032   _eol_armature_list = (eolArmature *)malloc(
00033           sizeof(eolArmature)*_eol_armature_max);
00034   if (_eol_armature_list == NULL)
00035   {
00036     eol_logger_message(
00037         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00038         "eol_armature: cannot allocate armature list!\n");
00039     return;
00040   }
00041   atexit(eol_armature_close);
00042   _eol_armature_initialized = eolTrue;
00043   eol_logger_message(EOL_LOG_INFO,"eol_armature: initialized\n");
00044 }
00045 
00046 eolBool eol_armature_initialized()
00047 {
00048   return _eol_armature_initialized;
00049 }
00050 
00051 eolArmature * eol_armature_new()
00052 {
00053   int i;
00054   if (!eol_armature_initialized())
00055   {
00056     eol_logger_message(EOL_LOG_ERROR,"eol_armature: not initialized\n");
00057     return NULL;
00058   }
00059   for (i = 0; i < _eol_armature_max;i++)
00060   {
00061     if (_eol_armature_list[i]._refCount == 0)
00062     {
00063       _eol_armature_list[i]._refCount = 1;
00064       return &_eol_armature_list[i];
00065     }
00066   }
00067   eol_logger_message(EOL_LOG_WARN,"eol_armature: out of space for new mesh data.\n");
00068   return NULL;
00069 }
00070 
00071 eolArmature * eol_armature_load(char *filename)
00072 {
00073   eolArmature *arm = NULL;
00074   if (!eol_armature_initialized())
00075   {
00076     eol_logger_message(
00077         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00078         "eol_armature: used uninitialized!\n");
00079     return NULL;
00080   }
00081   arm = eol_armature_get_by_filename(filename);
00082   if (arm != NULL)
00083     return arm;
00084   arm = eol_armature_new();
00085   if (arm == NULL)
00086     return NULL;
00087   strncpy(arm->filename,filename,EOLLINELEN);
00088   if (eol_armature_load_from_obj(filename,arm) != 0)
00089   {
00090     eol_armature_delete(arm);
00091     return NULL;
00092   }
00093   return arm;
00094 }
00095 
00096 void eol_armature_get_bone_count(FILE *file,eolArmature *arm)
00097 {
00098   eolLine buf;
00099   int numbones = 0;
00100   if ((!file) ||
00101       (!arm))
00102   {
00103     return;
00104   }
00105   rewind(file);
00106   while(fscanf(file, "%s", buf) != EOF)
00107   {
00108     if(strcmp(buf,"bonecount") == 0)
00109     {
00110       fscanf(file, "%i",&numbones);
00111       break;
00112     }
00113   }
00114   arm->boneCount = numbones;
00115 }

00117 void eol_armature_get_frame_count(FILE *file,eolArmature *arm)
00118 {
00119   eolLine buf;
00120   int numframes = 0;
00121   if ((!file) ||
00122       (!arm))
00123   {
00124     return;
00125   }
00126 
00127   rewind(file);
00128   while(fscanf(file, "%s", buf) != EOF)
00129   {
00130     if(strcmp(buf,"framecount") == 0)
00131     {
00132       fscanf(file, "%i",&numframes);
00133       break;
00134     }
00135   }
00136   arm->frameCount = numframes;

00138 
00139 eolBone *eol_armature_add_bone(eolArmature *arm,eolLine name,eolInt *index)
00140 {
00141   int i;
00142   if (index != NULL)
00143   {
00144     *index = -1;
00145   }
00146   if (!arm)return NULL;
00147   for (i = 0;i < arm->boneCount; i++)
00148   {
00149     if (strlen(arm->_bones[i].name)==0)
00150     {
00151       if (index != NULL)
00152       {
00153         *index = i;
00154       }
00155       arm->_bones[i].index = i;
00156       arm->_bones[i].parentIndex = -1;
00157       arm->_bones[i].hasParent = eolFalse;
00158       strncpy(arm->_bones[i].name,name,EOLLINELEN);
00159       return &arm->_bones[i];
00160     }
00161   }
00162   return NULL;
00163 }
00164 
00165 eolBone *eol_armature_get_bone_by_name(
00166     char *bonename,
00167     eolArmature *arm,
00168     eolInt *index)
00169 {
00170   int i;
00171   if ((!bonename) ||
00172       (!arm))
00173   {
00174     if (index != NULL)
00175     {
00176       *index = -1;
00177     }
00178     return NULL;
00179   }
00180   if (index != NULL)
00181   {
00182     *index = -1;
00183   }
00184 
00185   for (i = 0;i < arm->boneCount; i++)
00186   {
00187     if (strcmp(bonename,arm->_bones[i].name) == 0)
00188     {
00189       if (index != NULL)
00190         *index = i;
00191       return &arm->_bones[i];
00192     }
00193   }
00194   return NULL;
00195 }
00196 
00197 int eol_armature_load_bones(FILE *file,eolArmature *arm)
00198 {
00199   eolLine buf;
00200   eolLine bonename;
00201   int count = 0;
00202   int index = -1;
00203   int childindex = 0;
00204   int mindex = 0;
00205   int armindex = 0;
00206   float m1,m2,m3,m4;
00207   eolBone *bone = NULL;/* active bone for adding*/
00208   eolBone *temp = NULL;
00209   if ((!file) ||
00210       (!arm))
00211   {
00212     return -1;
00213   }
00214   rewind(file);
00215   while(fscanf(file, "%s", buf) != EOF)
00216   {
00217     if(strcmp(buf,"armature") == 0)
00218     {
00219       fscanf(file, "%s",arm->name);
00220       armindex = 0;
00221       continue;
00222     }
00223     if(strcmp(buf,"bone:") == 0)
00224     {
00225       childindex = 0;
00226       mindex = 0;
00227       fscanf(file, "%s",bonename);
00228       if (strlen(bonename) <= 0)
00229       {
00230         continue;
00231       }
00232       bone = eol_armature_get_bone_by_name(bonename,arm,NULL);
00233       if (bone != NULL)
00234       {
00235         /*bone must have been added by parent, but it is now active bone*/
00236         continue;
00237       }
00238       bone = eol_armature_add_bone(arm,bonename,NULL);
00239       if (bone == NULL)
00240       {
00241         eol_logger_message(
00242             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00243             "eol_armature:not enough space allocated for bones in armature %s\n",
00244             arm->filename
00245           );
00246         return -1;
00247       }
00248       continue;
00249     }
00250     if(strcmp(buf,"parent:") == 0)
00251     {
00252       fscanf(file, "%s",bonename);
00253       if (bone == NULL)
00254       {
00255         eol_logger_message(
00256             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00257             "eol_armature:parent specified before bone in armature %s\n",
00258             arm->filename
00259           );
00260         continue;
00261       }
00262       temp = eol_armature_get_bone_by_name(bonename,arm,&index);
00263       if (temp == NULL)
00264       { /*parent not yet added, so lets add it*/
00265         temp = eol_armature_add_bone(arm,bonename,&index);
00266       }
00267       if (temp == NULL)
00268       {
00269         /*at this point, the bone could not be added*/
00270         return -1;
00271       }
00272       bone->hasParent = eolTrue;
00273       bone->parentIndex = index;
00274       continue;
00275     }
00276     if(strcmp(buf,"childcount") == 0)
00277     {
00278       if (bone == NULL)
00279       {
00280         eol_logger_message(
00281             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00282             "eol_armature:childcount specified before bone in armature %s\n",
00283             arm->filename
00284           );
00285         continue;
00286       }
00287       fscanf(file, "%i",&count);
00288       if (count <= 0)
00289       {
00290         continue;
00291       }
00292       if ((bone->numChildren > 0) ||
00293           (bone->children != NULL))
00294       {
00295         eol_logger_message(
00296             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00297             "eol_armature:childcount specified twice for a bone in armature %s\n",
00298             arm->filename
00299           );
00300         continue;
00301       }
00302       bone->numChildren = count;
00303       bone->children = (eolInt *)malloc(sizeof(eolInt)*count);
00304       if (bone->children == NULL)
00305       {
00306         eol_logger_message(
00307             EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00308             "eol_armature:unable to allocate children for bone in armature %s\n",
00309             arm->filename
00310           );
00311         return -1;
00312       }
00313       memset(bone->children,0,sizeof(eolInt)*count);
00314       continue;
00315     }
00316     if(strcmp(buf,"child:") == 0)
00317     {
00318       if (bone == NULL)
00319       {
00320         eol_logger_message(
00321             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00322             "eol_armature:child specified before bone in armature %s\n",
00323             arm->filename
00324           );
00325         continue;
00326       }
00327       if (bone->children == NULL)
00328       {
00329         eol_logger_message(
00330             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00331             "eol_armature:child specified before allocation for bone in armature %s\n",
00332             arm->filename
00333           );
00334         continue;
00335       }
00336       fscanf(file, "%s",bonename);
00337       if (strlen(bonename) <= 0)
00338       {
00339         continue;
00340       }
00341       temp = eol_armature_get_bone_by_name(bonename,arm,&index);
00342       if (temp == NULL)
00343       { /*child not yet added, so lets add it*/
00344         temp = eol_armature_add_bone(arm,bonename,&index);
00345       }
00346       if (temp == NULL)
00347       {
00348         /*at this point, the bone could not be added*/
00349         return -1;
00350       }
00351       if (index < 0)
00352       {
00353         eol_logger_message(
00354             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00355             "eol_armature:child has bad index for armature %s\n",
00356             arm->filename
00357           );
00358         continue;
00359       }
00360       bone->children[childindex] = index;
00361       childindex++;
00362       continue;
00363     }
00364     if(strcmp(buf,"m:") == 0)
00365     {
00366       if (bone == NULL)
00367       {
00368         eol_logger_message(
00369             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00370             "eol_armature:matrix specified before bone in armature %s\n",
00371             arm->filename
00372           );
00373         continue;
00374       }
00375       fscanf(
00376           file,
00377           "%f %f %f %f",
00378           &m1,
00379           &m2,
00380           &m3,
00381           &m4
00382           );
00383 
00384       bone->matrix[mindex][0] = m1;
00385       bone->matrix[mindex][1] = m2;
00386       bone->matrix[mindex][2] = m3;
00387       bone->matrix[mindex][3] = m4;
00388       mindex++;
00389       continue;
00390     }
00391     if(strcmp(buf,"armmat:") == 0)
00392     {
00393       if (armindex >= 4)
00394       {
00395         eol_logger_warn(
00396           "eol_armature: too many armature matrix rows specified in armature %s\n",
00397           arm->filename
00398         );
00399       }
00400       fscanf(
00401           file,
00402           "%f %f %f %f",
00403           &m1,
00404           &m2,
00405           &m3,
00406           &m4
00407           );
00408       arm->matrix[armindex][0] = m1;
00409       arm->matrix[armindex][1] = m2;
00410       arm->matrix[armindex][2] = m3;
00411       arm->matrix[armindex][3] = m4;
00412       armindex++;
00413       continue;
00414     }
00415   }
00416   return 0;
00417 }
00418 
00419 int eol_armature_load_from_obj(char *filename,eolArmature *arm)
00420 {
00421   int i;
00422   eolFile *efile = NULL;
00423   if (arm == NULL)return -1;
00424   efile = eol_loader_read_file(filename);
00425   if (efile == NULL)return -1;
00426 
00427   eol_armature_get_bone_count(efile->file,arm);
00428 
00429   if (arm->boneCount <= 0)
00430   {
00431     eol_logger_message(
00432         EOL_LOG_WARN,
00433         "eol_armature: armature %s has no bones!\n",
00434         filename);
00435     eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00436     return -1;
00437   }
00438 
00439   arm->_bones = (eolBone *)malloc(sizeof(eolBone)*arm->boneCount);
00440   if (arm->_bones == NULL)
00441   {
00442     eol_logger_message(
00443         EOL_LOG_WARN,
00444         "eol_armature: cannot allocate bones!\n",
00445         filename);
00446     eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00447     return -1;
00448   }
00449   memset(arm->_bones,0,sizeof(eolBone)*arm->boneCount);
00450 
00451   if (eol_armature_load_bones(efile->file,arm) != 0)
00452   {
00453     eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00454     return -1;
00455   }
00456 
00457   eol_armature_get_frame_count(efile->file,arm);
00458   if (arm->frameCount > 0)
00459   {
00460     arm->_poses = (eolPose *)malloc(sizeof(eolPose)*arm->frameCount);
00461     if (arm->_poses == NULL)
00462     {
00463       eol_logger_message(
00464           EOL_LOG_WARN,
00465           "eol_armature: cannot allocate poses!\n",
00466           filename);
00467       eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00468       return -1;
00469     }
00470     memset(arm->_poses,0,sizeof(eolPose)*arm->frameCount);
00471 
00472     for (i = 0; i < arm->frameCount; i++)
00473     {
00474       arm->_poses[i].bones =
00475         (eolPoseBone*)malloc(sizeof(eolPoseBone)*arm->boneCount);
00476       if (arm->_poses[i].bones == NULL)
00477       {
00478         eol_logger_message(
00479             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00480             "eol_armature: cannot allocate pose bones!\n",
00481             filename);
00482         eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00483         return -1;
00484       }
00485       memset(arm->_poses[i].bones,0,sizeof(eolPoseBone)*arm->boneCount);
00486     }
00487     if (eol_armature_load_poses(efile->file,arm) == -1)
00488     {
00489       eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00490       return -1;
00491     }
00492   }
00493   eol_loader_close_file(&efile);
00494   return 0;
00495 }
00496 
00497 int eol_armature_load_poses(FILE *file,eolArmature *arm)
00498 {
00499   int index = -1;
00500   int boneindex = -1;
00501   int mindex = 0;
00502   eolLine bonename;
00503   eolLine buf;
00504   eolInt frame = -1;
00505   float m1,m2,m3,m4;
00506   if ((!file) ||
00507       (!arm))
00508   {
00509     return -1;
00510   }
00511   rewind(file);
00512   while(fscanf(file, "%s", buf) != EOF)
00513   {
00514     if(strcmp(buf,"frame:") == 0)
00515     {
00516       fscanf(file, "%i",&frame);
00517       frame--;
00518       boneindex = -1;
00519       /*we index from 0, the file indexes from 1*/
00520       continue;
00521     }
00522     if(strcmp(buf,"posebone:") == 0)
00523     {
00524       if (frame <= -1)
00525       {
00526         eol_logger_message(
00527             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00528             "eol_armature:posebone specified before frame for armature %s\n",
00529             bonename,
00530             arm->filename);
00531         continue;
00532       }
00533       fscanf(file, "%s",bonename);
00534       if (strlen(bonename) <= 0)
00535       {
00536         eol_logger_message(
00537             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00538             "eol_armature:bad bonepose for armature %s\n",
00539             arm->filename);
00540         continue;
00541       }
00542       eol_armature_get_bone_by_name(
00543           bonename,
00544           arm,
00545           &index);
00546       if (index == -1)
00547       {
00548         eol_logger_message(
00549             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00550             "eol_armature:cannot find bone %s for armature %s\n",
00551             bonename,
00552             arm->filename);
00553         continue;
00554       }
00555       mindex = 0;
00556       boneindex = index;
00557       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].boneIndex = boneindex;
00558       strncpy(arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].name,bonename,EOLLINELEN);
00559       continue;
00560     }
00561     if(strcmp(buf,"scale:") == 0)
00562     {
00563       if (frame == -1)
00564       {
00565         eol_logger_message(
00566             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00567             "eol_armature:scale specified before frame in armature %s\n",
00568             arm->filename
00569           );
00570         continue;
00571       }
00572       fscanf(
00573           file,
00574           "%f %f %f",
00575           &m1,
00576           &m2,
00577           &m3
00578           );
00579       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].scale.x = m1;
00580       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].scale.y = m2;
00581       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].scale.z = m3;
00582     }
00583     if(strcmp(buf,"lm:") == 0)
00584     {
00585       if (frame <= -1)
00586       {
00587         eol_logger_message(
00588             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00589             "eol_armature:matrix specified before frame in armature %s\n",
00590             arm->filename
00591           );
00592         continue;
00593       }
00594 
00595       if (boneindex == -1)
00596       {
00597         eol_logger_message(
00598             EOL_LOG_WARN,
00599             "eol_armature:matrix specified before posebone in armature %s\n",
00600             arm->filename
00601           );
00602         continue;
00603       }
00604       fscanf(
00605           file,
00606           "%f %f %f %f",
00607           &m1,
00608           &m2,
00609           &m3,
00610           &m4
00611           );
00612       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].matrix[mindex][0] = m1;
00613       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].matrix[mindex][1] = m2;
00614       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].matrix[mindex][2] = m3;
00615       arm->_poses[frame].bones[boneindex].matrix[mindex][3] = m4;
00616       mindex++;
00617       continue;
00618     }
00619   }
00620   return 0;
00621 }
00622 
00623 void eol_armature_free(eolArmature **arm)
00624 {
00625   if (!eol_armature_initialized())return;
00626   if ((arm == NULL) || (*arm == NULL))return;
00627   if ((*arm)->_refCount == 0)return;
00628   (*arm)->_refCount--;
00629   *arm = NULL;
00630   return;
00631 }
00632 
00633 void eol_armature_delete(eolArmature *arm)
00634 {
00635   int i;
00636   if (!arm)return;
00637   for (i = 0; i < arm->boneCount;i++)
00638   {
00639     if (arm->_bones[i].children != NULL)
00640     {
00641       free(arm->_bones[i].children);
00642     }
00643   }
00644   free(arm->_bones);
00645 
00646   for (i = 0; i < arm->frameCount;i++)
00647   {
00648     if (arm->_poses[i].bones != NULL)
00649     {
00650       free(arm->_poses[i].bones);
00651     }
00652   }
00653   free (arm->_poses);
00654   memset(arm,0,sizeof(eolArmature));
00655 }
00656 
00657 eolArmature * eol_armature_get_by_filename(char *filename)
00658 {
00659   int i;
00660   if (!eol_armature_initialized())return NULL;
00661   for (i = 0; i < _eol_armature_max; i++)
00662   {
00663     if ((_eol_armature_list[i]._refCount > 0) &&
00664         (strncmp(_eol_armature_list[i].filename,filename,EOLLINELEN)==0))
00665     {
00666       _eol_armature_list[i]._refCount++;
00667       return &_eol_armature_list[i];
00668     }
00669   }
00670   return NULL;
00671 }
00672 
00673 void eol_armature_cleanup()
00674 {
00675   int i;
00676   if (!eol_armature_initialized())return;
00677   for (i = 0; i < _eol_armature_max; i++)
00678   {
00679     if (_eol_armature_list[i]._refCount <= 0)
00680     {
00681       eol_armature_delete(&_eol_armature_list[i]);
00682     }
00683   }
00684 }
00685 
00686 void eol_armature_close()
00687 {
00688   int i;
00689   eol_logger_message(
00690     EOL_LOG_INFO,
00691     "eol_armature: closing\n"
00692     );
00693   for (i = 0;i < _eol_armature_max;i++)
00694   {
00695     eol_armature_delete(&_eol_armature_list[i]);
00696   }
00697   if (_eol_armature_list != NULL)
00698   {
00699     free(_eol_armature_list);
00700     _eol_armature_list = NULL;
00701   }
00702   _eol_armature_initialized = eolFalse;
00703   eol_logger_message(
00704     EOL_LOG_INFO,
00705     "eol_armature: closed\n"
00706     );
00707 }
00708 
00709 void
00710 eol_armature_link_mesh(
00711     eolArmature   *arm,
00712     eolMesh       *mesh
00713   )
00714 {
00715   int i;
00716   eolMat4 rot90matrix;
00717  
00718   if ((arm == NULL) || 
00719       (mesh == NULL))
00720   {
00721     eol_logger_warn(
00722       "eol_armature: passed null parameter to link_mesh\n"
00723       );
00724     return;
00725   }
00726   for (i = 0; i < arm->boneCount; i++)
00727   {
00728     arm->_bones[i].meshGroup =
00729         eol_mesh_get_group_by_name(arm->_bones[i].name,mesh);
00730   }
00731   rot90matrix[0][0]=1.0f;
00732   rot90matrix[1][0]=0.0f;
00733   rot90matrix[2][0]=0.0f;
00734   rot90matrix[3][0]=0.0f;
00735   
00736   rot90matrix[0][1]=0.0f;
00737   rot90matrix[1][1]=0.0f;
00738   rot90matrix[2][1]=1.0f;
00739   rot90matrix[3][1]=0.0f;
00740   
00741   rot90matrix[0][2]=0.0f;
00742   rot90matrix[1][2]=-1.0f;
00743   rot90matrix[2][2]=0.0f;
00744   rot90matrix[3][2]=0.0f;
00745   
00746   rot90matrix[0][3]=0.0f;
00747   rot90matrix[1][3]=0.0f;
00748   rot90matrix[2][3]=0.0f;
00749   rot90matrix[3][3]=0.0f;
00750 
00751   for (i = 0; i < mesh->_numVertices; i++)
00752   {
00753       eol_mat4_mult_vert(
00754           &mesh->_rest[i],
00755           arm->matrix,
00756           mesh->_rest[i]
00757       );
00758       eol_mat4_mult_vert(
00759           &mesh->_rest[i],
00760           rot90matrix,
00761           mesh->_rest[i]
00762       );
00763   }
00764   arm->_isLinked = eolTrue;
00765 }
00766 
00767 void
00768 eol_armature_deform_mesh(eolArmature *arm,eolMesh *mesh, eolUint frame)
00769 {
00770   eolPoseBone *tempframe = NULL;
00771   eolGroup *tempGroup = NULL;
00772   int i,j,v;
00773 
00774   if((mesh == NULL) ||
00775      (arm == NULL))
00776   {
00777     eol_logger_message(
00778       EOL_LOG_WARN,
00779       "eol_armature: passed null information to deform mesh.\n"
00780       );
00781     return;
00782   }
00783   if (!arm->_isLinked)
00784   {
00785     eol_logger_message(
00786       EOL_LOG_INFO,
00787       "eol_armature: armature %s is not linked.\n",
00788       arm->filename
00789     );
00790     return;
00791   }
00792   if(frame >= arm->frameCount)
00793   {
00794     eol_logger_message(
00795       EOL_LOG_INFO,
00796       "eol_armature: passed in frame %i, but armature only has %i frames.\n",
00797       frame,
00798       arm->frameCount
00799       );
00800   }
00801   if (frame == mesh->_curFrame)return;
00802   mesh->_curFrame = frame;
00803   tempframe = arm->_poses[frame].bones;
00804   for(j = 0; j < arm->boneCount; j++)
00805   {
00806     tempGroup = arm->_bones[tempframe[j].boneIndex].meshGroup;
00807     if (tempGroup == NULL)
00808     {
00809       continue;
00810     }
00811     if (strcmp(tempframe[j].name,tempGroup->name) != 0)
00812     {
00813       eol_logger_message(
00814         EOL_LOG_WARN,
00815         "eol_armature: posebone/group mismatch - posebone: %s, group %s\n",
00816         tempframe[j].name,
00817         arm->_bones[tempframe[j].boneIndex].name
00818         );
00819     }
00820     if (strcmp(tempGroup->name,arm->_bones[tempframe[j].boneIndex].name) != 0)
00821     {
00822       eol_logger_message(
00823         EOL_LOG_WARN,
00824         "eol_armature: bone/group mismatch - bone: %s, group %s\n",
00825         tempGroup->name,
00826         arm->_bones[tempframe[j].boneIndex].name
00827         );
00828     }
00829     for(i = 0; i < tempGroup->numVerts; i++)
00830     {
00831       v = tempGroup->vertices[i];
00832       if (v < 0)
00833       {
00834         eol_logger_error(
00835           "eol_armature: underseeking in group %s\n",
00836           tempGroup->name);
00837         continue;
00838       }
00839       if (v >= mesh->_numVertices)
00840       {
00841         eol_logger_error(
00842           "eol_armature: overseeking in group %s\n",
00843           tempGroup->name);
00844         continue;
00845       }
00846       eol_mat4_mult_vert_factor(
00847           &mesh->_vertices[tempGroup->vertices[i]],
00848           tempframe[j].matrix,
00849           mesh->_rest[tempGroup->vertices[i]],
00850           tempGroup->weights[i]
00851       );
00852     }
00853   }
00854 }
00855 
00856 eolBool
00857 eol_armature_descendant_of(
00858     eolArmature *arm,
00859     eolBone *ancestor,
00860     eolBone *descendant
00861   )
00862 {
00863   int p;
00864   if ((descendant == NULL) ||
00865       (arm == NULL) ||
00866       (ancestor == NULL))
00867   {
00868     eol_logger_message(
00869       EOL_LOG_WARN,
00870       "eol_armature: descendant_of passed NULL parameter\n"
00871     );
00872     return eolFalse;
00873   }
00874   if (descendant->hasParent == eolFalse)
00875   {
00876     return eolFalse;
00877   }
00878   p = descendant->parentIndex;
00879   while ((p != -1) && (p < arm->boneCount))
00880   {
00881     if (&arm->_bones[p] == ancestor)
00882     {
00883       return eolTrue;
00884     }
00885     if (!arm->_bones[p].hasParent)break;
00886     p = arm->_bones[p].parentIndex;
00887   }
00888   return eolFalse;
00889 }
00890 
00891 void
00892 eol_armature_print_bone_hierarchy(
00893   eolArmature *arm
00894   )
00895 {
00896   int b,c;
00897   if (arm == NULL)return;
00898   eol_logger_message(
00899   EOL_LOG_INFO,
00900   "eol_armature: Bone Hierarchy for armature %s\n",
00901   arm->filename);
00902   for (b = 0; b < arm->boneCount; b++)
00903   {
00904     eol_logger_message(
00905       EOL_LOG_INFO,
00906       "bone %s has\n",
00907       arm->_bones[b].name);
00908     if (arm->_bones[b].parentIndex != -1)
00909     {
00910       eol_logger_message(
00911         EOL_LOG_INFO,
00912         "\tparent: %s\n",
00913         arm->_bones[arm->_bones[b].parentIndex].name);
00914     }
00915     else
00916     {
00917       eol_logger_message(
00918         EOL_LOG_INFO,
00919         "\t<no parent>\n");
00920     }
00921     if (arm->_bones[b].numChildren <= 0)
00922     {
00923       eol_logger_message(
00924         EOL_LOG_INFO,
00925         "\t\t<no children>\n");
00926       continue;
00927     }
00928     for (c = 0; c < arm->_bones[b].numChildren; c++)
00929     {
00930       eol_logger_message(
00931         EOL_LOG_INFO,
00932         "\t\tchild %s\n",
00933         arm->_bones[arm->_bones[b].children[c]].name);
00934       continue;         
00935     }
00936   }
00937 }
